org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode

Class SPQRLinearOpMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode
      • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode
        • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.SPQRLinearOpMode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RRWSP, TestOpMode

    public abstract class SPQRLinearOpMode
extends com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode
    Custom Linear OpMode class with extra functions. Used mainly for autonomous.

      This method calculates and returns the average encoder value of all of the robot's drive motors using the values of each encoder position of each drive motor of the robot.

      This method resets the encoder positions of the drive motors to zero and adds the current encoder position to the total encoder positions.

    • Method Detail

      • strafe

        protected void strafe(org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.Dir direction,
                      double distance,
                      double speed)
        This method strafes the robot in the given direction by a given distance in centimeters (or millimeters, unsure) at a specified speed. The robot will go backwards if the speed given is a value less than zero.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction that the robot should strafe in.
        distance - A double which represents the distance for the robot to travel in millimeters.
        speed - A double between -1.0 and 1.0 which is the speed at which the robot is to drive.

      • drive

        public void drive(double distance,
                  double speed)
        This method drives the robot forward by a given distance in centimeters (or millimeters, unsure) at a specified speed. The robot will go backwards if the speed given is a value less than zero.
        Parameters:
        distance - A double which represents the distance for the robot to travel in millimeters.
        speed - A double between -1.0 and 1.0 which is the speed at which the robot is to drive.

      • resetEncoders

        protected void resetEncoders(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor.RunMode runMode)
        This method resets the encoder positions of the drive motors to zero and adds the current encoder position to the total encoder positions.

      • driveAverage

        protected double driveAverage()
        This method calculates and returns the average encoder value of all of the robot's drive motors using the values of each encoder position of each drive motor of the robot.
        Returns:
        A double which represents the average encoder values of all of the robot's drive motors.

      • turn2

        public void turn2(double angle,
                  double speed)
        This method synchronously turns the robot to a specified angle (in degrees) that is relative to the robot at a given speed. This uses calculations based off of the definition of radians.
        Parameters:
        angle - A double which is the relative angle (in degrees) to turn.
        speed - A double between -1.0 and 1.0 which is the speed at which the robot is to turn. This value will be assigned as the speed of the motors

      • updateTelemetry

        protected void updateTelemetry()
        This method updates the telemetry data on both the driver station and the robot controller with common debugging information.

      • waitForRings

        protected Rings waitForRings(int waitFor)
        This method attempts to detect the amount of rings in a stack. If it can not find rings in the specified amount of time, it assumes there are no rings.
        Parameters:
        waitFor - How long to wait for in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The detected amount of rings.
